abstracts.cdata!:
The indigenous peoples plan (IPP) seeks
            to support the Basic Education Quality Improvement Project
            for Panama on its effort to provide quality intercultural
            bilingual education (IBE) to bilingual children speaking
            indigenous languages. There are two components to the
            project. The first component of the project is to improve
            the teaching and learning process in basic education. This
            is can be achieved by: (i) elaboration of a
            diagnosis/inventory to define and validate competencies of
            teacher, directives and supervisors of basic education in
            indigenous region; (ii) training of directives and
            supervisors to correct the gaps detected in the diagnosis in
            indigenous regions; and (iii) formulation of a proposal of
            special IBE teacher training. The second component of the
            project is to increase coverage and retention of students in
            preschool and basic education age. Some of the activities
            included in the project that involve the indigenous peoples
            plan are: (i) expansion of IBE preschool (CEFACEI)
            coordinate with DNEIB; (ii) expansion of telebasica in
            indigenous regions. Coordinate with telebasica Dir; (iii)
            adaptation of reinforcement programs with an intercultural
            focus. Training of teachers to apply reinforcement programs
            for students at risk of failing school in basic education in
            indigenous regions; (iv) study to evaluate alternative
            pedagogical proposals to serve students in highly disperse
            indigenous regions; (v) carry out technical training for the
            implementation of IBE model; and (vi) study to evaluate
            alternative pedagogical proposals to serve students in
            highly disperse indigenous regions.
